Title: Discovering the anticancer potential of non-oncology drugs by systematic viability profiling
Author: Corsello S
Featured Abstract: Anticancer uses of non-oncology drugs have occasionally been found, but such discoveries have been serendipitous. We sought to create a public resource containing the growth-inhibitory activity of 4,518 drugs tested across 578 human cancer cell lines. We used PRISM (profiling relative inhibition simultaneously in mixtures), a molecular barcoding method, to screen drugs against cell lines in pools.

Title: High-throughput identification of genotype-specific cancer vulnerabilities in mixtures of barcoded tumor cell lines
